summary: The text discusses calculations derived from the Book of Daniel, describing the prophecy concerning the timeframe from the first year of Darius to the coming of Christ, considered to have been fulfilled in sixty-two and a half weeks. It also includes a discussion on the interpretations by early Christian scholars like Tertullian, who linked the vision seen by Daniel to specific historical kings and timeframes leading to Christ's appearance. Tertullian calculates these timelines starting from the first year of Darius through a succession of kings and their reigns, extending to the time of Christ.
